oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-06-09 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-06-09 part 1. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Dick Noel, starring Count Basie and his Orchestra with vocalist Joe Williams, and featuring the Penguins, and Dori Anne Gray. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Count Basie Orchestra; Penguins; Dori Anne Gray
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Alan Freed) -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Dick Noel) -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra -- Basie's Back In Town (Count Basie Orchestra) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Alan Freed introduces the Penguins -- Earth Angel (Penguins) -- Alan Freed introduces Dori Anne Gray -- Pitty Pat Band (Dori Anne Gray) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra -- Bubbles (Count Basie Orchestra)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Camel rock 'n roll dance party (Radio program); Freed, Alan; Basie, Count, 1904-1984; Count Basie Orchestra; Williams, Joe, 1918-1999; Penguins (Musical group); Gray, Dori Anne; Melamed, Louis
